key_title: Key to species of Roepera in Victoria

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Zygophyllaceae

leads.lead_text: Fruit 4-winged, indehiscent, remaining complete or splitting into 2–4 mericarps
Fruit 4- or 5-angled, splitting into 4 or 5 locules which release the seeds
Petals obovate, obtuse or slightly emarginate, much longer than sepals, golden-yellow; fruit 12–18 mm long, splitting into 2–4 indehiscent mericarps when ripe; seed 1 (rarely 2) per mericarp
Petals narrow-oblanceolate, more or less acute, hardly longer than sepals, pale lemon-yellow; fruit 8–12 mm long, not splitting into mericarps when ripe; seed usually 1 per fruit
Capsule 5-celled, 5-angled; flowers 5-merous; stamens 10
Capsule 4-celled, 4-angled; flowers 4-merous; stamens 8 or 4
Leaves sessile or subsessile
Leaves distinctly petiolate

Capsule more or less turbinate, truncate at apex, with a short blunt appendage at upper corner of each angle; leaflets obliquely obovate, 10–40 mm long, 5–20 mm wide; perennial (sometimes annual) with a woody base
Capsule more or less globose, rounded at apex, lacking appendages at the angles; leaflets oblong- to obovate-cuneate, 10–20 mm long, 3–10 mm wide; annual herb
Leaflets crenate at apex, usually with 3 blunt teeth; plant annual
Leaflets or lobes of leaves entire or notched at apex; plant annual or perennial
Capsule rounded at apex
Capsule truncate at apex
Petals white, usually shorter than sepals; capsule ellipsoid, 6–8 mm long; seeds usually 2 per cell
Petals yellow, longer than sepals; capsule ovoid-oblong to obovoid-oblong, 7–20 mm long; seeds 2–5 per cell
Leaves simple, bifid; lobes ovate to suborbicular, 8–25 mm long, more or less appressed to each other by their upper surfaces; capsule obovoid, 7–10 mm long; petals 3–6 mm long
Leaves with 2 leaflets that are articulate at base; leaflets oblique-obovate, 10–40 mm long, divergent in same plane; capsule ovoid-oblong to obovoid-oblong, 14–20 mm long; petals 8–15 mm long
Capsule 6–20 mm long; petals yellow; plant perennial
Capsule 5–7 mm long; petals white; plant annual
Capsule 14–20 mm long; leaflets oblique-obovate, 3–22 mm wide, often glaucous
Capsule 6–12 mm long; leaflets linear to elliptic, 2–12 mm wide, green
Leaflets linear to narrow oblong-elliptic, 2–3 (–4) mm wide; petals narrow-obovate to elliptic, 4–8 mm long; inland shrubs 30–60 cm high
Leaflets oblong-elliptic to elliptic, mostly (3–) 4–12 mm wide; petals obovate- cuneate, 8–15 mm long; robust scrambling or climbing coastal shrubs

Stamens 4; petals narrow-obovate to narrow-elliptic, usually as long as or slightly longer than sepals; seeds 3 or 4 per cell; leaflets usually abruptly truncate at apex, sometimes rounded to almost emarginate
Stamens 8; petals cuneate, shorter than to as long as sepals; seeds 1 or 2 per cell; leaflets rounded at apex
